text: Pours white lace, amber/copper. Nose is of fruity esters reminiscent of Belgians ales, whisky barrel wooden notes, liquorice, spices. Taste is liquorice, boozy. Caramel, lingering spiciness. Interesting beer, rather unique complexity.
GABF 2013. Deep brown, well carbonated. Caramel and bready malt heavy nose. Full bodied, some fruit and bread. Didnt get oak, whiskey, or any of the Pugachevs coming out.

Appearance: Pours a dark reddish brown with a lasting creamy tan film.

Aroma: Roasted and toasted malt. Chocolate and fresh hops.



Taste: Toasted chocolate like malt, dark chocolate.Mild spicy hops.Black forest cake. Slight barrel.

Mouthfeel: Full bodied active carbonation.

Overall: One of the best beers H24 has ever made, looking forward to the 100% barrel aged version.

Clear dark amber color with ivory head. Nice dark toast, lagered caramel, dark fruit aromas. Medium body with average co2. Toast, caramel, medium sweet flavors with dry wood, spicy alcohol,,, smoooth finish.-----good
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Draft. Mahogony beer with a cream head. Caramel aroma. Toffee and caramel flavor with light earthiness. Medium boldied. Toffee and caramel linger with light earth and light mineral notes.

On tap. Medium brown with a fizzy off white head. Malty cereal grain, toffee, and molasses aroma. Medium bodied palate. Tastes of sweet cereal grain, molasses, and toffee with some tannins from the oak showing through on the finish.

On draft at the Livermore Saloon. It pours a dark brownish red color with a khaki head. The aroma is a good balance of toasted malt with some cherry and dry notes of wood. The flavor has toasty malt with just a hint of roasted malt, cherry, earth and spicy wood in the finish. Very well balanced and warming. It was a delight.

On tap at the Barrel Party. Pours with a hazed brown hued body with a retentive tan head. Aromas are of brown sugar, oak, sweet malt, melanoidins, pencil shavings. A bit raw. Clean ester wise. Flavors are of currants, earthy, brown sugar, clean, molasses, lightly bready, barrel, melanoidins. Lots of oak. Warming, medium carbonation.
My co-favorite at the 2012 Barrel Aged Beer Event.  Lovely milk chocolate taste in this medium nut brown colored barrel beer.  More "alt-y" than Pugachev and easy to sip.
From a bottle,amber in color, clear, no head, Chocolate and hints of bourbon,sweet.I like it a lot.
Draft: Poured a light brown with reddish orange edges, the head was off white. Aroma was full of spice and malt. Taste was roasted malt with nice hot spice, hints of rye alcohol finish.

App: pours reddish brown with beige head that sticks around. aroma of brown sugar, hint of molasses, caramel. Taste is sweet with no bitterness. Palate is thick, sticky and chewy. Seems like it is probably a great beer for what it is but it isnt what im looking for. Too Sweet. Really really sweet.

thanks to Tim for the hookup on this, and in the new 4th Ann glass to boot.  You rock!  Pours dark brown with a huge light tan head that leaves a nice lacing the length of the glass.  Aroma is really nice and have tremendous depth.  Big toast and nutty malts, the rye whiskey is apparent but finessed well as it only complements.  Flavor is extremely rich, caramel and light roast notes blend with nutty character and big wood in the finish.  This is awesome stuff, and one of my favorites from this brewery.
Clear reddish brown hue. Mild licorice aroma.  Malty, prune and licorice flavor. Mild easy drinking body.

1st rating from tap at Hangar. Dark pour with reddish tint and a chestnut head. Taste is dark toasted rye bread and biscuits with a hint of some barrel roll in there. Almost like a sessionable barrel roll. Nicely done.
